page.title: 11CATON ROAD DEVELOPMENTS-111
page.content: The first factory in that area was a amunitions factory,near Green Ayre Station,which was built during the First World War.Afterwards a factory making Acetate Rayon was there.This became Lansil and in the 1960's when production was at it's height it employed 2,200 workers and covered over thirty acres.However in 1982 the factory was closed.Lancaster City Council bought the derelict site with money from the Goverment's Derilict Land Grant,and began cleaning it up . There are still factories working in that area now,Standfast Dyers and Printers and Woodeaves plus small warehouse units,(Beehive Units-Barcleys Bank)and the developments around them. In the future the Special Planning Group using money from the European Economic Community,who have already given &150.000 for this development.
